# Netscape HTTP Cookie File
# This is a generated file! Do not edit.
# To use YouTube cookies:
# 1. Install a browser extension like "Get cookies.txt LOCALLY" (Chrome/Firefox)
# 2. Go to youtube.com and make sure you're logged in
# 3. Click the extension icon and export cookies
# 4. Save the exported cookies as cookies.txt
# 5. Upload to /tmp/cookies.txt on the server (or set COOKIES_FILE env var)
#
# Cookie format (tab-separated):
# domain	flag	path	secure	expiration	name	value
#
# Example (replace with your actual cookies):
# .youtube.com	TRUE	/	TRUE	1234567890	CONSENT	YES+cb
# .youtube.com	TRUE	/	FALSE	1234567890	PREF	f1=50000000
